description:
He may be short in stature, but Sora Kurumatani can soar and score on the basketball court! With a passion for the sport he inherited from his mother, Sora vows to her that he’ll take top prize at a high school basketball tournament… but there’s one problem. His new school’s basketball club has turned into a hangout for delinquents! Will Sora’s sheer tenacity and amazing three-point shooting change their minds and get the club up and running again?

(Source: Sentai Filmworks)

tags.name: Basketball
tags.description: Centers around the sport of basketball.

tags.name: School Club
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a school club scene.

tags.name: Primarily Male Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of male characters.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

tags.name: Primarily Teen Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of teen characters.

tags.name: Coming of Age
tags.description: Centers around a character's transition from childhood to adulthood.

tags.name: Delinquents
tags.description: Features characters with a notorious image and attitude, sometimes referred to as "yankees".

tags.name: Bullying
tags.description: Prominently features the use of force for intimidation, often in a school setting.

tags.name: Twins
tags.description: Prominently features two or more siblings that were born at one birth.

node.description:
**Date of Birth:** 1972
**Place of Birth:** Ibaraki Prefecture, Japan  
**Gender:** Male

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/hinatatakeshi)

He was an assistant for [Masashi Asaki](https://anilist.co/staff/97577/Masashi-Asaki) during the publication of Psychometrer Eiji.
Since around 2012, Shingo Tamaki has been actively involved in [diomedéa](https://anilist.co/studio/51/diomeda) productions.
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/zappago)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/yoshino_honda)

Affiliated with [diomedéa](https://anilist.co/studio/51/diomeda).

**the pillows** were a Japanese alternative rock band, best known internationally for the soundtrack of the anime series FLCL. the pillows were originally "Coin Locker Babies" but was changed after Kenji left the band (KENZI&THE TRIPS).  

**Members: **
[Sawao Yamanaka](https://anilist.co/staff/172230/Sawao-Yamanaka) (Born December 7th, 1968) – vocals, rhythm guitar 
Yoshiaki Manabe (Born October 2, 1962) – lead guitar 
Shinichirou Sato (Born August 16, 1964) – drums 
Jun Suzuki – bass (support member, since 1999)  

**Former Members:** 
Kenji Ueda (Born August 30, 1965) – bass (1989–1992) 
Tatsuya Kashima – bass (support member, 1992–1999)

Kusakawa Keizou is a storyboarder and director working for [Seven Arcs](https://anilist.co/studio/35/Seven-Arcs). During his early years at the studio he has worked under [Shinbou Akiyuki](https://anilist.co/staff/100089/Akiyuki-Shinbou) and has since then been also involved in several shows directed by Shinbou at [Shaft](https://anilist.co/studio/44/Shaft). Kusakawa also took over the duties as director of the Lyrical Nanoha series from Shinbou after he left Seven Arcs, starting with its second season, Mahou Shoujo Lyrical Nanoha A's
[Profile (Miracle Bus)](http://miraclebus.com/composer/hiroakitsutsumi) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/hiroaki850605)

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/明田川仁)

Affiliated with Magic Capsule, a recording studio led by his father [Susumu Aketagawa](https://anilist.co/staff/120062).
Affiliated with [CygamesPictures](https://anilist.co/studio/6182/CygamesPictures).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/magicmagico) He joined Okayasu Promotion after graduating and studied there as editor, he collected experience on tv animation and drama and gave his debut on Ninja Hattori. He is currently working for 1000 Yamakoshi. Not to be confused with the other Toshihiko Kojima whose name is written with different Kanji.

__[Website](https://saji.tokyo/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/saji_official) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/saji_staff/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/c/sajiofficial)__

__Formed:__ December 2010 in Sapporo College of Broadcasting Arts, Music and Dance, Sapporo City, Hokkaido Prefecture, Japan
__Genres:__ Rock, Anison

__Introduction:__
saji is a Japanese three-piece rock band under record label King Records (2019–), having previously been under TOY'S FACTORY (2011–2016). They used to go under the name phatmans after school, before changing their name in July 2019.

__Members:__
- [Takumi Yoshida](https://anilist.co/staff/162404/Takumi-Yoshida) (ヨシダタクミ) – vocalist, guitarist and in-charge of lyrics and composition
- [Yoshimitsu Yamazaki](https://twitter.com/yoshimitsu_4gen) (ヤマザキヨシミツ) – bassist
- [Shinya Yuutani](https://twitter.com/flying_megane) (ユタニシンヤ) – guitarist
_Note: Not to be confused with the [animator](https://anilist.co/staff/254528/)._

__Agency:__ Intention

[Website](https://www.uchidayuma.com/) | [Profile](https://intention-k.com/profile/yuma_uchida) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/yuma_u_official) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/i_am_yumauchida)

A Japanese voice actor and singer. He made his singing debut in May 2018 under the King Records label. He is [Maaya Uchida](https://anilist.co/staff/108639/)'s younger brother.

His agency announced that he married the voice actress [Rina Hidaka](https://anilist.co/staff/100250) on January 1st, 2024.

__Awards:__
- In 2017, he won Best Male Newcomer at the 11th Seiyuu Awards for his role as [Hayate Immelmann](https://anilist.co/character/90102/).
- In 2019, he won Best Male Lead Actor at the 13th Seiyuu Awards for his role as [Ash Lynx](https://anilist.co/character/13580/).

__Non-Anime Roles:__
- Kaveh - Genshin Impact (VG)
- Aaron Wei (The Legend of Heroes Series)
- G'raha Tia - Final Fantasy XIV (VG)
-Anaxa - Honkai: Star Rail (VG)

Flumpool is a Japanese rock band of four from Osaka. The name is a compound word of f from the English word four, since there are 4 members, along with the word meaning mass, lump, and the word pool. Flumpool falls under the label of A-Sketch.

Yamamura has been writing the lyrics for almost all of their songs and Sakai has been doing the composing.

Members:
• Ryuta Yamamura (山村 隆太) - vocals, guitar
• Kazuki Sakai (阪井 一生) - guitar
• Genki Amakawa (尼川 元気) - bass
• Seiji Ogura (小倉 誠司) - drums

(Source: MAL)

name.native: ブルー・エンカウント

node.description:
__[Website](https://blueencount.jp/)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/BLUEN_official)__ | __[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/blueencount_official/)__ | __[YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/user/blueencountSMEJ)__

__Formed:__ 2004
__Genres:__ Rock (Mixture Rock, Indie Rock), Emo

__Introduction:__
Blue Encount (stylized as BLUE ENCOUNT), alternatively known under the abbreviation BLUEN is a Japanese four-piece rock band under record label Ki/oon Records (2014-), who have previously been under record label 美音 (Mio) (2013-2014)

__Biography:__
In 2003, Shunichi, Yuuya and Yoshihide met at a vocational school in the Kumamoto Prefecture, where they would later in 2004 form the band Blue Encount. The band's name derives from a jinx that says bands with a color in their name sells, as well as a movie that the vocalist Shunichi saw at a rental shop titled "Blue Encounter".

In 2006, at the TEENS' MUSIC FESTIVAL, which was sponsored by the Yamaha Music Promotion Association and Nippon Broadcasting, they participated in the Kyuushuu qualifying round as the Kumamoto Prefecture representative, but they did not advance to the national competition. The bassist at the time withdrew from the band to enter university, and after graduating from a certain college of technology Yuuya and Yoshihide came to Tokyo and began studying at the Tokyo School of Music College in Shibuya. Yuuta, a senior at a vocational school participated as a support member at the time.

In 2008, the band participated in Yamaha's "The 2nd Music Revolution JAPAN FINAL" as a representative of Tokyo FINAL. This is also when Yuuta officially decided to join the band.

In 2010, the band released their first mini album titled "The Beginning of the Beginning". The response on the album were not as expected, and the members of the band instead called it "The Dark Ages". After that, they went on a split tour with the bands ircle and SUPER BEAVER, and said that occasional advice from both of the bands was a large help to escape the "dark age" as they called it.

On April 11, 2012, the 2nd mini album "HALO EFFECT" was released. The title song "HALO" has helped increase the number of YouTube views, and the number of live shows started piling in for them as a band.

On November, 2013, they released a split album titled "BONEDS" with the bands [MY FIRST STORY](https://anilist.co/staff/127675/My-First-Story), AIR SWELL and [SWANKY DANK](https://anilist.co/staff/132868/SWANKY-DANK).

On September 10, 2014, they made a major debut under Ki/oon Music with their EP titled "TIMELESS ROOKIE", this is also when they left their previous record label titled 美音 (Mio).

On October 9, 2016, the band made had their first one-man live show held at the Nippon Budokan. The tickets sold out the same day and had 11.000 people pending for the show. In addition, during this live performance, they directy spoke with the producer of the Japanese television drama "THE LaST COP/ラストコップ", and was then scheduled to perform the theme song for the show. The drama first broadcasted on the October 29, which is when they made their first appearance in a serial TV drama as a unit.

__Members:__
- [Shunichi Tanabe](https://anilist.co/staff/148599/Shunichi-Tanabe) (田邊駿一) - vocalist, guitarist and in-charge of lyrics and composition (2004-)
- Yuuya Eguchi (江口雄也) - guitarist (2004-)
- Yuuta Tsujimura (辻村勇太) - bassist (2006-2008, as a support member) (2008-, as an official member)
- Yoshihide Takamura (高村佳秀) - drummer (2004-)

(Source: [Wikipedia (BLUE ENCOUNT)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/BLUE_ENCOUNT), edited)

(Source: [Wikipedia (BLUE ENCOUNT)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/BLUE_ENCOUNT), edited)

__[Twitter](https://twitter.com/BLUEN_VO) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/bluenvo/)__ Introduction Shunichi Tanabe is a Japanese lyricist, composer, vocalist, guitarist and member of the band BLUE ENCOUNT. Biography Born in Kagoshima Prefecture, raised in Kumamoto Prefecture, he graduated from the Kumamoto City, Hanazono Elementary School, after which he finished Kumamoto City, Iori Junior High School, and then proceed to drop out of Kumamoto National College of Technology. In elementary school he was a member of the soccer team, while in junior high he was a ghost member and the captain of the badminton team. Shunichi's trademark black-rimmed glasses contain no lenses, as he uses contact lenses in combination with these empty glasses. In the band Shunichi is the only member without a driver's license, he is also a very extroverted individual, as he likes to bond through the acts of skinship. (Source: Wikipedia)

__[Twitter](https://twitter.com/BLUEN_VO) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/bluenvo/)__ Introduction Shunichi Tanabe is a Japanese lyricist, composer, vocalist, guitarist and member of the band BLUE ENCOUNT. Biography Born in Kagoshima Prefecture, raised in Kumamoto Prefecture, he graduated from the Kumamoto City, Hanazono Elementary School, after which he finished Kumamoto City, Iori Junior High School, and then proceed to drop out of Kumamoto National College of Technology. In elementary school he was a member of the soccer team, while in junior high he was a ghost member and the captain of the badminton team. Shunichi's trademark black-rimmed glasses contain no lenses, as he uses contact lenses in combination with these empty glasses. In the band Shunichi is the only member without a driver's license, he is also a very extroverted individual, as he likes to bond through the acts of skinship. (Source: Wikipedia)

__Birthplace:__ Osaka Prefecture

__Jin Nakamura__ is a Japanese composer, arranger and music producer.

__Height:__ 182 cm (6'0")

[Website](https://miyanomamoru.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/miyanomamoru_pr) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCHzevlEL9JfsBIm86uNCJqg)

A Japanese actor, voice actor, singer and narrator from Saitama Prefecture.

Miyano joined The Himawari Theatre Group at the age of 7 under the influence of his older brother, yet he did not attend the class as much as he should have. After entering high school, due to the uncertainty he felt towards the future, Miyano started attending singing and dance lessons he has been skipping until now. While taking music lessons, Miyano started to discover his music style through the encounter with music produced by singers like CHEMISTRY and EXILE. Miyano's first acting job was in 1992 in Tokusou Exceedraft, where he appeared in a flashback as a child in a yakuza member's past.

In 2001, he had his voice acting debut in a live action teen drama Caitlin's Way.

In 2002, he voiced Riku in the Japanese version for the video game Kingdom Hearts. Miyano also had his first anime voice acting role the same year, voicing Akira in [Shin Megami Tensei Devil Children: Light & Dark](https://anilist.co/anime/4068/). In 2003, he voiced [Kiba](https://anilist.co/character/241/), the main character in [Wolf's Rain](https://anilist.co/anime/202/). A few years later in 2006, he had what most would call his breakout role in [Death Note](https://anilist.co/anime/1535/) where he voiced the main character [Light Yagami](https://anilist.co/character/80/). For his role as Light, he was nominated for two awards at the first ever Seiyuu Awards in March 2007.

On May 28, 2007, on the King Records label, Miyano debuted as a singer with the single "Kuon." The single debuted at number 47 on the Oricon charts and was used as the ending theme song for anime series [Koutetsu Sangokushi](https://anilist.co/anime/2162/). On June 13, he released a collaboration single titled "Fight," with fellow voice actress [Romi Park](https://anilist.co/staff/95082/). The duo's single debuted on the Oricon chart at number 73.

In 2008, at the second Seiyuu Awards, Miyano won "Best Actor in a Leading Role" for his roles [Setsuna F. Seiei](https://anilist.co/character/4234/) and [Rikuson Hakugen](https://anilist.co/character/2844/), from [Mobile Suit Gundam 00](https://anilist.co/anime/2581/) and [Koutetsu Sangokushi](https://anilist.co/anime/2162/) respectively. Miyano also married later that same year and he and his wife have a son together.

__Non-anime voice roles:__
- Riku - *Kingdom Hearts* series (VG)
- Ignis Scientia - *Final Fantasy XV* (2016 VG)
- Peter B. Parker - *Spider-Man: Into The Spider Verse; Spider-Man: Across the Spider-Verse* (Films; JP dub)
- Mario - *The Super Mario Bros. Movie* (2023 Film; JP dub)
- Newt Scamander - *Fantastic Beasts* series (Live action films; JP dub)
- Percy Weasley - *Harry Potter* franchise (Live action films; JP dub)

__Height:__ 182 cm (6'0")

[Website](https://miyanomamoru.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/miyanomamoru_pr) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCHzevlEL9JfsBIm86uNCJqg)
